title: In the home stretch! Please help me finish a WaJo run...[Piedmont Factory 42]
author: brass_rat

posts.post_title: In the home stretch! Please help me finish a WaJo run...[Piedmont Factory 42]
posts.post_content:
Hi all,

[This is also posted in the T-card section since I am looking for (dreaming of) a few non-T206, but I'm mainly looking for the two T206 below. Thank you.]

I'm down to a few cards needed for my Walter Johnson (hands-at-chest) back run.  I look forward to posting the run once I find the SC 350/25 and the P42!

If anybody has ever seen a T215-1, please let me know -- I've only ever seen scans of the Type 2.

Cheers,
Steve

[quote name="brass_rat" post=1467613]Hi all,

[This is also posted in the T-card section since I am looking for (dreaming of) a few non-T206, but I'm mainly looking for the two T206 below. Thank you.]

I'm down to a few cards needed for my Walter Johnson (hands-at-chest) back run.  I look forward to posting the run once I find the SC 350/25 and the P42!

If anybody has ever seen a T215-1, please let me know -- I've only ever seen scans of the Type 2.

Cheers,
Steve[/QUOTE]


Very impressive Steve. Wish I could help you out but you've got way more backs than I have :cool:

Thanks, Josh.  I've been looking forward to sharing for awhile, but I want to have a "completed" (my definition) run to show.  :)

Cheers,
Steve

Wow Steve, what a great run. Good luck finishing it. That BL 460 will really be tough, as will the Red Cross. And the Pirate may be impossible. 

But you have some amazing cards already. A yellow/brown scrap? And a T213 Factory 8 overprint? And some great T206s. I wish I could help. Good luck.

I'm working on a Gabby Street back-run. I'm still missing the Red Hindu, Lenox, and Piedmont 42. Also the Red Cross. Maybe in a few years we can scan our cards together, Walter and his catcher.   :)

Haha, thanks,  Sean -- thanks why I labeled those as "dreaming"...:)

I didn't make a serious run at the BL460 in REA a few years back...back prices are crazy (to me), and I know I haven't helped.

The only Pirate I know of is staying in that gentleman's collection, and Val has the T214 and T215-2 in his amazing WaJo collection.  So I'm not worrying myself with finding those.  :)

Cheers, 
Steve

I found a SC 350/25, so I'm down to the Piedmont Factory 42 (for what I consider attainable).  

If anybody has any leads, I'd love to track one down through a private transaction -- not too keen on an auction at this point.

Cheers,
Steve

Thanks, Robert.  I really want to have the P42 before I put together a nice back run picture to share. :)

Cheers, 
Steve

Steve,

Tough card for sure !! I have seen a few but they are not out often for sale. I will keep an eye out for you.

Adam

Thanks, Adam -- I appreciate it!
Steve
